# The `SeparateConstOffsetFromGEP` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

A pass that tries to split every GEP in the function into a variadic base and a constant offset. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

## Description {#details}

A pass that tries to split every GEP in the function into a variadic base and a constant offset.

It is a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/functionpass">FunctionPass</a> because searching for the constant offset may inspect other basic blocks.

Definition at line 370 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/separateconstoffsetfromgep-cpp">SeparateConstOffsetFromGEP.cpp</a>.

## Private Member Functions

### accumulateByteOffset() {#a34c6254b2375360c3b8d15636a4122a6}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>int64&#95;t SeparateConstOffsetFromGEP::accumulateByteOffset (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/getelementptrinst">GetElementPtrInst</a> &#42; GEP, bool &amp; NeedsExtraction)</>}>
Finds the constant offset within each index and accumulates them.

If LowerGEP is true, it finds in indices of both sequential and structure types, otherwise it only finds in sequential indices. The output NeedsExtraction indicates whether we successfully find a non-zero constant offset.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/separateconstoffsetfromgep-cpp/#l00424">424</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/separateconstoffsetfromgep-cpp">SeparateConstOffsetFromGEP.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### canonicalizeArrayIndicesToIndexSize() {#a36d03720ef3271aff9370aeabc7c192e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool SeparateConstOffsetFromGEP::canonicalizeArrayIndicesToIndexSize (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/getelementptrinst">GetElementPtrInst</a> &#42; GEP)</>}>
Canonicalize array indices to pointer-size integers.

This helps to simplify the logic of splitting a GEP. For example, if a + b is a pointer-size integer, we have gep base, a + b = gep (gep base, a), b However, this equality may not hold if the size of a + b is smaller than the pointer size, because LLVM conceptually sign-extends GEP indices to pointer size before computing the address (<a href="http://llvm.org/docs/LangRef.html#id181">http://llvm.org/docs/LangRef.html#id181</a>).

This canonicalization is very likely already done in clang and instcombine. Therefore, the program will probably remain the same.

Returns true if the module changes.

Verified in @i32&#95;add in split-gep.ll

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/separateconstoffsetfromgep-cpp/#l00441">441</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/separateconstoffsetfromgep-cpp">SeparateConstOffsetFromGEP.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### lowerToArithmetics() {#a9a4c1632ae616c5661f48e1a88fcb0a3}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void SeparateConstOffsetFromGEP::lowerToArithmetics (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/getelementptrinst">GetElementPtrInst</a> &#42; Variadic, int64&#95;t AccumulativeByteOffset)</>}>
Lower a GEP with multiple indices into ptrtoint+arithmetics+inttoptr form.

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> splitGEP already split the original GEP into a variadic part and a constant offset (i.e., AccumulativeByteOffset). This function lowers the variadic part into a set of arithmetic operations and applies AccumulativeByteOffset to it. <code>Variadic</code> The variadic part of the original GEP. <code>AccumulativeByteOffset</code> The constant offset.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/separateconstoffsetfromgep-cpp/#l00416">416</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/separateconstoffsetfromgep-cpp">SeparateConstOffsetFromGEP.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### lowerToSingleIndexGEPs() {#a5cfe73904889cd0583c0e2335ea3e686}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void SeparateConstOffsetFromGEP::lowerToSingleIndexGEPs (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/getelementptrinst">GetElementPtrInst</a> &#42; Variadic, int64&#95;t AccumulativeByteOffset)</>}>
Lower a GEP with multiple indices into multiple GEPs with a single index.

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> splitGEP already split the original GEP into a variadic part and a constant offset (i.e., AccumulativeByteOffset). This function lowers the variadic part into a set of GEPs with a single index and applies AccumulativeByteOffset to it. <code>Variadic</code> The variadic part of the original GEP. <code>AccumulativeByteOffset</code> The constant offset.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/separateconstoffsetfromgep-cpp/#l00406">406</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/separateconstoffsetfromgep-cpp">SeparateConstOffsetFromGEP.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

Tries to reorder the given GEP with the GEP that produces the base if doing so results in producing a constant offset as the outermost index.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/separateconstoffsetfromgep-cpp/#l00397">397</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/separateconstoffsetfromgep-cpp">SeparateConstOffsetFromGEP.cpp</a>.

### reuniteExts() {#a53735bc3a671b8f2ac94c51febad895a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool SeparateConstOffsetFromGEP::reuniteExts (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &amp; F)</>}>
Optimize sext(a)+sext(b) to sext(a+b) when a+b can&#39;t sign overflow.

<a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-separateconstoffsetfromgep-cpp-/separateconstoffsetfromgep">SeparateConstOffsetFromGEP</a> distributes a sext to leaves before extracting the constant offset. After extraction, it becomes desirable to reunion the distributed sexts. For example, <CodeBlock>                         &amp;a&#91;sext(i +nsw (j +nsw 5)&#93;
</CodeBlock> =&gt; distribute &amp;a&#91;sext(i) +nsw (sext(j) +nsw 5)&#93; =&gt; constant extraction &amp;a&#91;sext(i) + sext(j)&#93; + 5 =&gt; reunion &amp;a&#91;sext(i +nsw j)&#93; + 5

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/separateconstoffsetfromgep-cpp/#l00452">452</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/separateconstoffsetfromgep-cpp">SeparateConstOffsetFromGEP.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

A helper that reunites sexts in an instruction.
